item.title: Version 2 of the Project Accounting Timesheet Recalc has been released.
item.description: A new version of the Project Accounting Timesheet Recalc Utility (Version 2.0) has been released to address a customer’s need. This utility is designed for Dynamics GP users who utilize Project Accounting Timesheets to track salaried employees’ time. Salaried employees receive fixed payroll costs. However, when their worked hours fluctuate from the standard hours within a pay period, the general ledger project timesheet costs don’t align with their actual payroll expenses.

item.title: Costs for timesheets in project accounting
item.description: Lately, Steve and I have been collaborating on a customization to tackle a recurring obstacle I encounter with project accounting timesheets for salaried employees. It’s a problem that bothers me enough that I frequently seek reassurance from others in the field, such as project accounting consultants, trainers, and Microsoft support. What exactly is the issue? Let’s illustrate with a scenario: Employee 1 earns a salary of $1000 per week, resulting in an hourly rate of $25 based on a 2080-hour work year.
